We will cover personal pronouns and how to change verbs for the past, present, and future tenses."},"learningObjectives":["Master the Egyptian Arabic subject pronouns","Conjugate regular verbs in the Present Continuous tense (Bi- prefix)","Conjugate regular verbs in the Past tense (Suffixes)","Conjugate regular verbs in the Future tense (Ha- prefix)","Apply gender and number rules to verbs"],"estimatedDuration":60,"prerequisites":["Basic reading skills","Introduction to Egyptian sounds"],"subLessons":[{"id":"sl_01_pronouns","title":{"arabic":"الضمائر الشخصية","english":"Subject Pronouns","transliteration":"El-damayer el-shakhseya"},"content":{"title":{"arabic":"مين بيعمل الفعل؟","english":"Who is doing the action?","transliteration":"Meen byi3mel el-fi3l?"},"phrases":[{"arabic":"أنا","english":"I","transliteration":"Ana"},{"arabic":"إنتَ","english":"You (masculine)","transliteration":"Enta"},{"arabic":"إنتي","english":"You (feminine)","transliteration":"Enti"},{"arabic":"هو","english":"He","transliteration":"Howa"},{"arabic":"هي","english":"She","transliteration":"Heya"},{"arabic":"إحنا","english":"We","transliteration":"E7na"},{"arabic":"إنتوا","english":"You (plural)","transliteration":"Ento"},{"arabic":"هما","english":"They","transliteration":"Homma"}],"explanations":[{"english":"Before conjugating verbs, you must know the pronouns. In Egyptian Arabic, 'You' has three forms (Male, Female, Plural). 'They' has only one form (Homma) used for both males and females."}]},"exercises":[{"id":"ex_01_match_pronoun","type":"matching","question":{"english":"Match the pronoun to the correct gend
